use_case.title: Delete a Portlet from a Portal Tab
use_case.description: This use case describes the series of events necessary to delete a portlet in an already existing Portal Tab

trigger.value: A PA is interested in deleting a Portlet from a Tab within a Portal

use_case.basic_path:
1. Beginning at the Portal, a PA clicks the "Configure Portal" link
  2. On the Configure Portal page, the PA is presented with a list of all Tabs that currently reside within the Portal. Next to the name of each Tab, is a link saying "configure" and a link saying "delete".
  3. The PA chooses the Tab he or she would like to delete a Portlet from, and chooses the "Configure" link for that Tab
  4. The Tab configuration page presents the PA with an Option to "Add/Remove Portlets". The PA selects this link
  5. On the Add/Remove Portlets page, all available Portlets appear as a checkable list, partitioned conveniently by Package Type. Portlets already included within this Tab are pre-checked, while unused available Portlets appear as unchecked
  6. The PA unchecks those Portlets he or she wishes to remove, and then clicks the "Save Configuration"button
  7. The PA is returned to the Tab configuration Page
use_case.success_end_conditions: The desired Portlets are removed from the Portal
